name: impracticably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is impossible to do or manage effectively: The sample required for accurate separation is impracticably large. The list of items they would have to collect was impracticably long.
More examplesFewer examplesThe other requirement is that the liquid should not be impracticably toxic. To overcome the problem of low density, the traps must be impracticably large.There is a widely-held belief that for at least some of these conditions, the full treatment is impracticably difficult.
